Hi Thu, I have a few comments, mainly around naming, but the big one is the memory-safety issue.
`PLDM_PLATFORM_CPER_EVENT_MIN_LENGTH`?
Done

`pldm_platform_cper_event_format_type`?

Also, do we need the `type` suffix? Can we just have `pldm_platform_cper_event_format`?
Done
`PLDM_PLATFORM_CPER_...`
Done
Why have you put these new API declarations in-between the encode and decode APIs for message poll event? That's a bit too chaotic for my taste.
I just want to put the API decode/encode for the PLDM eventClass in the same place.
Check line 2176 above and then line 2197 below, and reconsider whether putting your new functions declarations in-between those two is sensible.
I moved the added API to the end of file.
`decode_pldm_platform_cper_event_data()`?
Done
As `struct pldm_platform_cper_event` has a flexible array member you must also pass the length of `cper_event` as an argument to the function.
Done
When was the last time you assigned to `rc`?
Done
When was the last time you assigned to `rc`?
Done

There's no overflow check, and we don't have enough information to do one as you haven't passed the length of the `cper_event` object through the API.

I think we may need to improve the API of `pldm_msgbuf_exract_array_uint8()` as you're not the first person making this mistake.

I think the `pldm__msgbuf_extract_array_void` API which is called by `pldm_msgbuf_extract_array_uint8` already check the overflow condition as below.
https://github.com/openbmc/libpldm/blob/8be6bc3541598ecb318c43b1fd3ef36578b39c54/src/msgbuf.h#L747
Done

can you please add a comment on the line above that tells the reader this check protects the call to `pldm_msgbuf_extract_array_uint8()` below from overflowing `cper_event->event_data`.

Also, I think it's more accurate if this test is `cper_event_length < (event_data_length - PLDM_PLATFORM_CPER_EVENT_MIN_LENGTH)`?

The expectation is `cper_event_length == (event_data_length - PLDM_PLATFORM_CPER_EVENT_MIN_LENGTH)` so the condition should be `cper_event_length != (event_data_length - PLDM_PLATFORM_CPER_EVENT_MIN_LENGTH)` I think.
Done
I think we can drop this based on the check on line 2008?
This condition check the `event data length` in CPER event message. it is different with the calculated `cper_event_length` value.
Done

Can you please rebase this patch on top of [libpldm: Introduce LIBPLDM_CC_COUNTED_BY()](https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/73665) and then annotate this flexible array?

```
uint8_t event_data[] LIBPLDM_CC_COUNTED_BY(event_data_length)
```
Done
Thanks for the comment, however can you please fix the whitespace?
Done
`!=` is too strict. It's fine if the buffer is over-allocated. We just want `<`.

We want `cper_event_length < (event_data_length - PLDM_PLATFORM_CPER_EVENT_MIN_LENGTH)` to avoid overflow. So this check should be `cper_event_length > (event_data_length - PLDM_PLATFORM_CPER_EVENT_MIN_LENGTH)`

We're reading from `event_data` and writing to `cper_event->data`. We're reading `cper_event->event_data_length` from `event_data`, so we need

```
cper_event->event_data_length <= (event_data_length - PLDM_PLATFORM_CPER_EVENT_MIN_LENGTH) <= (cper_event_length - sizeof(*cper_event))
```

to hold. If it doesn't hold, then we need to return an error, as we'll either perform an invalid read or an invalid write.

The check you have denies over-allocation for `cper_event`, which is _not_ a concern. _Under-allocation_ is the concern, as the result would be an out-of-bounds access.

The comparison should be `<`.
Done
This prevents the valid message data from being smaller than the provided buffer. I think the check is too strict, and should be `>` instead.
Done
See the comment on PS5.
Done

Note that you were passing the data length for `cper_event_length` in the tests - rather, this should be the complete size of the object pointed to by the `cper_event` parameter.
